column1: #mapping_set_description: Phenotypes are the set of Mammalian Phenotype ontology (MP) terms that are annotated to mouse genotypes annotated as models of the human disease Scoliosis (DOID:0060249) or its child term idiopathic scoliosis (DOID:0060250). Genotypes and annotated MP terms were extracted from MouseMine (7/28/22) using the templates and list functions. Use of mappings terms: exact match: MP term is the same as the HPO term, ignoring that the HP term applies only to humans; broad match: HPO term covers more than the MP term, ignoring species restriction; narrow match: HPO term is more restricted than the MP term; related match: MP term and HPO term share some similarity but would not have a parent-child relation in a shared ontology

column10: note MP def. does not mention ribs and sternum but these are included in the child terms

column1: Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology
column10: MP term includes developmental cell types that may not be included in the HP term
MP term is about the process, HP term is about the morphological outcome, note the MP has a separate term for abnormal bone mineral density

while the terms have the same label and text definition, the child terms are distinct as MP term is on the physiology branch and is about the process, both use GO term in eq, HPO term is on the morphology branch and has child terms about morphological outcomes
note there is a synonym match between the MP term and the HPO term Abnormality of the calvaria but these are not exact matches
HPO definition states "process" but placement is under morphology
